titleStmt.title: W. T. Otto to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1177

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Department of the Interior,
Washington, D. C., 9th March 1864.
Sir:

In accordance with the provisions of the act of Congress for the increase of internal revenue, you are hereby notified that a stamp of the denomination of five cents must be attached to each certificate accompanying your Emolument Return, or other documents transmitted to this Department, and subsequently forwarded to the accounting officers of the Treasury.

I am, sir, very respectfully,
Your obedient servant,
W. T. Otto
Assistant Secretary.

Thomas Bramlette Eq
U. S. Dist atty
Louisville,
Ky
